meanings.definition: To officially support or agree with a proposal or motion made by someone else.
meanings.sent1: I seconded my friend's idea during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The committee seconded the new policy unanimously.
meanings.sent3: The team seconded the plan to have a pizza party for lunch.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was seconded by everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher seconded the student's suggestion to have a field trip.

meanings.definition: To transfer an employee temporarily to work in a different department or location.
meanings.sent1: The manager seconded Sarah to the marketing team for a month.
meanings.sent2: They seconded John to the overseas branch for a special project.
meanings.sent3: The company seconded Tom to the IT department to help with the software upgrade.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a nomad being seconded to various offices throughout the year.
meanings.sent5: The nurse was seconded to the emergency room during the busy weekend.
